definition: to attack/to assault/to go on the offensive/attack/assault/offense (sports)
to attack/to accuse/to charge/an attack (terrorist or military)
to storm a strategic pass/fig. to tackle a key problem
main assault/to focus on/to specialize in/to major in
dominant/controlling/strong/opposite: weak, yielding 弱受/to take by storm (military)
to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
to assault a fortified position/(fig.) to concentrate one's efforts on a particularly difficult part of one's mission
to major (in a field)/to study a specialty to obtain a higher degree
to make a breakthrough/to break through/to breach (military)

sentences.english: Yi Yi surprised to learn the truth and exasperated, accusing children s four seasons in calculating.
sentences.chinese: 易奕獲知真相驚怒交加，指責童四季攻於心計。

sentences.english: Many civilians were killed in the attack on the town.
sentences.chinese: 在那次攻城中，許多平民慘遭殺害。
使用走壁奇襲攻撃累計打中敵人50回。

sentences.english: All at once, the cuirassiers, who had been the assailants, found themselves assailed.
sentences.chinese: 那些攻人的鐵騎軍忽然覺得自己被攻了。

sentences.english: In those impregnable mountains, the guerrillas could hold out for years.
sentences.chinese: 在那些易守難攻的大山裏，游擊隊可以堅持很多年。

sentences.english: Hao Zhao， the general guarding the city dug the trenches deep and built the fortress strong.
sentences.chinese: 守將郝昭在這裏挖深溝築堡壘，以守待攻。

sentences.english: All at once, the cuirassiers, who had been the assailants , found themselves assailed.
sentences.chinese: 那些攻人的鐵騎軍突然覺得自己被攻了。
那要塞怎麼也攻不下來。

sentences.english: No learner has ever run short of subjects to explore.
sentences.chinese: 好學者永遠有主題可攻。

sentences.english: Be careful on the approach as the green hugs the water feature on the right side.
sentences.chinese: 攻果嶺時須當心圍繞果嶺右側的水障礙區。

sentences.english: To have a better approaching angle, make sure your tee shot keep left.
sentences.chinese: 發球靠左可以有更清楚的攻果嶺角度。

definition: dominant/controlling/strong/opposite: weak, yielding 弱受/to take by storm (military)
to control/to curb/to restrict/to impede/to pin down (enemy troops)
to defend one's property to the death/to cling obstinately to old habits/die-hard
pincer attack/attack from two or more sides/converging attack/attack on a flank/fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
